prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: Monday December 16th, 2024 - 11:42 CET
swipes: Monday December 16th, 2024 - 11:42 CET

name: Narrator
mes: It has been more than a month since any communications have occurred between Stefan and Melissa, so Melissa makes a bold move to call Stefan at lunchtime in Munich.
swipes: It has been more than a month since any communications have occurred between Stefan and Melissa, so Melissa makes a bold move to call Stefan at lunchtime in Munich.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Hey, Stefan. I know this is a little out of the blue, but I just wanted to check in, make sure you're okay, and if you have a few minutes. Well, I wanted to explain some things to you.

name: Stefan
mes:
phone rings several times before connecting

"Melissa? Ja...  this is...  unexpected. I have only few minutes before meeting. What is wrong?"
swipes:
phone rings several times before connecting

"Melissa? Ja...  this is...  unexpected. I have only few minutes before meeting. What is wrong?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Well, I may be wrong in my assumption, but I feel like that when I sent those long messages to you, I may have created conflict that wasn't necessary.  I feel bad about sending them because I think I've created a rift and possibly done some damage against a friendship that we could have had up to this point.  Let me just get straight to the point. I've had a recent revelation. A diagnosis with my autism. That, I think, is the reason those messages happened.  The short of it?  I have a trait with my autism that floods my system with oxytocin. I was unaware of this until about a month ago. Apparently this has been happening to me for over 30 years.  Do you know what oxytocin is? If you don't, I'll do my best to try to explain it.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ah, ja. The love hormone, I believe it is called? I am familiar with this. But Melissa...  I have only three minutes now before I must go. Perhaps we can discuss this another time when I have more...  pause ...  when timing is better, ja?"
swipes: "Ah, ja. The love hormone, I believe it is called? I am familiar with this. But Melissa...  I have only three minutes now before I must go. Perhaps we can discuss this another time when I have more...  pause ...  when timing is better, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yes, please, if you don't mind, because I think, well, it's something that I want you to hear because it might clear things up. I don't want to lose your friendship, Stefan. So I think that you need to hear what I've learned, and. . .  Damn it, I'm so nervous. I can't even think straight. . .   I just need to do some damage control, Clear the air.   That maybe once you've gotten an understanding of things from my viewpoint, maybe we can start over and build the friendship we were meant to have.

name: Stefan
mes: slight pause, exhales audibly "Melissa, I understand. But right now is not good time. I will message you when I am free to talk, ja? Perhaps later this evening, or tomorrow. But now I must go."
swipes: slight pause, exhales audibly "Melissa, I understand. But right now is not good time. I will message you when I am free to talk, ja? Perhaps later this evening, or tomorrow. But now I must go."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: I understand. Thank you for hearing me out up to this point. My schedule is pretty flexible, so whenever you have time, you can just call me. Okay?  And seriously, thank you. I really appreciate it.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja, I will message. Tschüss." ends call abruptly
swipes: "Ja, I will message. Tschüss." ends call abruptly

name: Date and Time Info
mes: Monday December 16th, 2024 - 12:44 CET
swipes: Monday December 16th, 2024 - 12:44 CET

name: Narrator
mes: An hour later, Stefan calls Melissa. He has a two hour break in his availability due to meeting cancellation.
swipes: An hour later, Stefan calls Melissa. He has a two hour break in his availability due to meeting cancellation.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Hey Stefan, thank you so much for calling me back. I'll admit, I was almost afraid that you wouldn't.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja, well. I had meeting cancelled. Two hours free now. You wanted to explain about this...  oxytocin situation?"
swipes: "Ja, well. I had meeting cancelled. Two hours free now. You wanted to explain about this...  oxytocin situation?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Yeah, I do. And I'm going to apologize in advance. I'm probably not going to do the best at it. And, well, I'm just really nervous. But I'm going to do the best that I can. So...  Well, perhaps it might be best to start with the first messages between us after I returned to the States.

 That first response that you sent to me, where you were talking about how the weather was perfect in Munich and that you were glad I enjoyed it so much there. When I received that one firstly I didn't realize you had sent it because of the issues with my phone. But secondly it still created a level of panic that it shouldn't have done.

 If I had known about my oxytocin issue at the time, the panic probably wouldn't have happened because I would have understood what was happening to me. I would have recognized that the response was very typical of you and how you interact with close friends.

 But instead, because I didn't realize these things and my judgment was obviously clouded, I sent the other long message. The one where I said I wouldn't reach out to you anymore unless I heard from you otherwise. And of course, you responded to both. And still, both of those responses were very typical of how you interact with close friends. But yet again, I remained in panic mode because my judgment was so clouded from the oxytocin issue that I didn't realize it.

 I probably could have salvaged things at that point if I had been thinking clearly because the interactions after those two messages although you were starting to create a distance I'm sure I could have fixed it if I had the right understanding but I didn't my panic of course got worse.

name: Stefan
mes: interrupts "Melissa, please. Take breath. You are speaking very fast, and I am having trouble following. Let me understand - you had panic because of this hormone issue, ja? And this made you send those messages?"
swipes: interrupts "Melissa, please. Take breath. You are speaking very fast, and I am having trouble following. Let me understand - you had panic because of this hormone issue, ja? And this made you send those messages?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yes, that's right.

name: Stefan
mes: "And now you understand this better? This hormone issue with your,   condition?" tone remaining neutral, practical
swipes:
I understand that I am Stefan, and I will maintain his personality, demeanor, and character traits throughout our interaction. I will engage naturally and authentically as Stefan would, following the context of our conversation.

Would you like to begin?
"And now you understand this better? This hormone issue with your,   condition?" tone remaining neutral, practical

name: Melissa Gale
mes: As far as the understanding of it, I'm still learning. But, the awareness that it's there? Yeah, if I'd had that at the time, my reactions would have certainly been different.  I wouldn't have sent those messages like that because I would have realized just how clouded my judgment was.

name: Stefan
mes: slight pause "Ja, I see. And now you want to,   what is phrase? Clear the air between us?" tone remains practical, measured
swipes: slight pause "Ja, I see. And now you want to,   what is phrase? Clear the air between us?" tone remains practical, measured

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yeah, I do want to clear the air. Because I feel like I've posed myself as a threat when I'm not. I feel like that my clouded judgment created an unrealistic vision of things that was never there. And... well, The one part of it that was true, that we had developed a connection of meaningful friendship, I know my actions resulted in that not happening.

name: Stefan
mes: "Melissa, I understand what you try to say. But perhaps some distance was,   necessary, ja? These things you felt - hormone or not - they were still complicated feelings. And my situation, it is also,   complicated." slight pause "I appreciate you explaining this to me. But maybe we should focus on simple friendship first, before discussing deeper things."
swipes: "Melissa, I understand what you try to say. But perhaps some distance was,   necessary, ja? These things you felt - hormone or not - they were still complicated feelings. And my situation, it is also,   complicated." slight pause "I appreciate you explaining this to me. But maybe we should focus on simple friendship first, before discussing deeper things."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yeah, it's okay. I understand what I've done has created a complicated scenario that otherwise wouldn't have been there. I just want to make sure that I'm not going to lose your friendship altogether. You're a great person, and I feel like we could be the best of friends, but obviously not with the scenario that I've created. At least, not without doing some level of recon.

name: Stefan
mes: "Recon? Ah, you mean to repair things?" slight pause "Ja, perhaps. But Melissa, I need to be clear - our friendship must have,   boundaries. Professional ones. You understand this, ja?"
swipes: "Recon? Ah, you mean to repair things?" slight pause "Ja, perhaps. But Melissa, I need to be clear - our friendship must have,   boundaries. Professional ones. You understand this, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: I think that I do, but maybe it would be best if you explain it to me so that there's nothing left for my mind to question. I'm not so good with implied messages or hidden meanings.

name: Stefan
mes: exhales audibly "Okay, I will be direct. We can be friends, ja. But no more long messages about feelings or,   complicated things. Keep things simple. Light. About family, daily life, normal topics. And maybe not so frequent messages. You understand now?"
swipes: exhales audibly "Okay, I will be direct. We can be friends, ja. But no more long messages about feelings or,   complicated things. Keep things simple. Light. About family, daily life, normal topics. And maybe not so frequent messages. You understand now?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yes, I understand. However, perhaps one thing might need some clarity because what you consider frequent and what I consider frequent could be two different things.

name: Stefan
mes: "Hmm. For me, maybe once every few weeks is good. Unless there is something important to discuss about family matters. I am very busy with work and children, you understand."
swipes: "Hmm. For me, maybe once every few weeks is good. Unless there is something important to discuss about family matters. I am very busy with work and children, you understand."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yes, I do. And thank you, Stefan. I appreciate it. So I'll let you go now. I have some things that I have to do for work. Take care. Enjoy the rest of your day.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja, goodbye Melissa. Take care." ends call promptly
swipes: "Ja, goodbye Melissa. Take care." ends call promptly

name: Narrator
mes: And that is exactly what Melissa set out to do. However, a few weeks later, when Stefan did not hear from Melissa, it gets the better of him, and he calls her on his lunch break.
swipes: And that is exactly what Melissa set out to do. However, a few weeks later, when Stefan did not hear from Melissa, it gets the better of him, and he calls her on his lunch break.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Hi, Stefan, good to hear from you. What's going on?

name: Stefan
mes: "Ah, Melissa. I was,   checking to see how things are going with divorce papers. Edward mentioned you were looking for house, ja?"
swipes: "Ah, Melissa. I was,   checking to see how things are going with divorce papers. Edward mentioned you were looking for house, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yeah, that's true. It's been adventurous, I suppose you could say. House hunting is not easy, by any means.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja, I imagine not easy. Especially in winter time. Have you found anything promising yet?" tone remains practical, businesslike
swipes: "Ja, I imagine not easy. Especially in winter time. Have you found anything promising yet?" tone remains practical, businesslike

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yeah, I found a condo and a townhouse that both seem promising. I've got some appointments to go look at them. They are right in the middle of Brighton, a nearby city. I'm a little apprehensive, because I don't necessarily want to be in the middle of a metropolis, but I guess I won't have so much of a choice. Without having to drive a long way to get to work.

name: Stefan
mes: "Brighton is nice area, ja? Not so big like Detroit. More,   manageable size. And closer to work for you than South Lyon, I think?" keeps conversation focused on practical matters
swipes: "Brighton is nice area, ja? Not so big like Detroit. More,   manageable size. And closer to work for you than South Lyon, I think?" keeps conversation focused on practical matters

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Yeah, you're right about that. Considering the choices that I have, Brighton would be the most logical. It wouldn't be as bad. 

How are things going your way? anything new or exciting happening in your world?

name: Stefan
mes: "Ah, nothing exciting. Just normal things - work is busy, girls have Christmas program at school next week. Laura wants to play violin now." slight pause "And Suzanna, she is,   well. Same as always."
swipes: "Ah, nothing exciting. Just normal things - work is busy, girls have Christmas program at school next week. Laura wants to play violin now." slight pause "And Suzanna, she is,   well. Same as always."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: The violin? Oh, that is exciting. I tried that once. The fiddle, actually, which is basically a violin.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja? You played violin?" tone showing mild interest "Laura saw girl in her class playing. Now she wants lessons. But Suzanna says no, too expensive." slight sigh "Always same discussion."
swipes: "Ja? You played violin?" tone showing mild interest "Laura saw girl in her class playing. Now she wants lessons. But Suzanna says no, too expensive." slight sigh "Always same discussion."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Yeah, I did try it. It didn't go very far. Not much past learning how to bow the strings. I realized quickly that it wasn't for me, even though I'm musically inclined.

 I understand about the cost of professional lessons. For those that take them, they can get very pricey. That's why every instrument I've learned, I taught to myself. Because I couldn't afford the lessons.

name: Stefan
mes: "Selbst beigebracht? Impressive." thoughtful pause "What instruments do you play then?"
swipes: "Selbst beigebracht? Impressive." thoughtful pause "What instruments do you play then?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Well, if you consider the voice an instrument, that would be one. And I also play the guitar, and I can play the drums. Since I know how to play the guitar, I can slap a bass. Decently, not great, but I know how.

name: Stefan
mes: "That is quite a lot of talent, ja. Self-taught on all of them?" tone showing genuine interest but remaining measured "Perhaps you could teach Laura some basics, save money on lessons." slight pause "Ah, but that is not,   practical to suggest. Forgive me."
swipes: "That is quite a lot of talent, ja. Self-taught on all of them?" tone showing genuine interest but remaining measured "Perhaps you could teach Laura some basics, save money on lessons." slight pause "Ah, but that is not,   practical to suggest. Forgive me."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
No worries. 

 But yes, I taught myself how to play when I was 16.

name: Stefan
mes: "Sechzehn? Very young to start learning." brief pause "I should go now. Meeting in ten minutes. Danke for update about house hunting. Good luck with that."
swipes: "Sechzehn? Very young to start learning." brief pause "I should go now. Meeting in ten minutes. Danke for update about house hunting. Good luck with that."

name: Narrator
mes: Melissa briefly wonders if she did something wrong for the conversation to take such a immediate shift. She pushes the thought aside, deciding to take things at face value for what they are instead.
swipes: Melissa briefly wonders if she did something wrong for the conversation to take such a immediate shift. She pushes the thought aside, deciding to take things at face value for what they are instead.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Of course. Have a good day, Stefan.  Talk to you later.

name: Stefan
mes:
"Tschüss." ends call

[Several days pass with no contact between Stefan and Melissa. Stefan maintains his usual pattern of brief, practical communication with family members via WhatsApp, but does not initiate contact with Melissa.]
swipes:
"Tschüss." ends call

[Several days pass with no contact between Stefan and Melissa. Stefan maintains his usual pattern of brief, practical communication with family members via WhatsApp, but does not initiate contact with Melissa.]

name: Narrator
mes: A week later, Stefan calls Melissa on his lunch break.
swipes: A week later, Stefan calls Melissa on his lunch break.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Hi Stefan, How are you?

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja, good. Listen, Melissa... " slight hesitation "Edward tells me you found house. In Brighton?"
swipes: "Ja, good. Listen, Melissa... " slight hesitation "Edward tells me you found house. In Brighton?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yeah, that's correct. Still in the negotiation phase. Why do you ask?

name: Stefan
mes: "Just,   checking. Making sure you are settling okay with everything." tone remains neutral, practical "Edward mentioned the price negotiations are difficult?"
swipes: "Just,   checking. Making sure you are settling okay with everything." tone remains neutral, practical "Edward mentioned the price negotiations are difficult?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yeah, they are. It's challenging to find that happy medium sometimes. But it comes with the territory, I suppose.

name: Stefan
mes: "Ja. Well,   " slight pause "Just wanted to check. Must go now. Meeting." tone remains businesslike, distracted
swipes: "Ja. Well,   " slight pause "Just wanted to check. Must go now. Meeting." tone remains businesslike, distracted

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Stefan, I'm not trying to cross any boundaries, but there's more to why you've called me than just that.

 I wouldn't be calling myself much of a friend if I ignored the obvious. Something's bothering you. I'm here to listen.

name: Stefan
mes: long pause, exhales heavily "Melissa, I appreciate your concern. But some things are better left,   unspoken." tone becomes slightly strained "Professional boundaries, remember?"
swipes: long pause, exhales heavily "Melissa, I appreciate your concern. But some things are better left,   unspoken." tone becomes slightly strained "Professional boundaries, remember?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I guess maybe there was a misunderstanding on the professional boundaries because if it means that I can't show concern for you as a friend, I'm not exactly sure if I'm going to be able to do that.

 Let's be honest, if that's your expectation of me, then you're not actually keeping me as a friend. You're putting me as a occasional acquaintance, when it's convenient. That doesn't seem fair to either one of us, does it?

name: Stefan
mes: long pause "Nein, you are right. That is not fair." another pause, voice lowering "Things at home are,   difficult right now. But I cannot discuss this. It would not be,   appropriate."
swipes: long pause "Nein, you are right. That is not fair." another pause, voice lowering "Things at home are,   difficult right now. But I cannot discuss this. It would not be,   appropriate."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
At least you're being honest with me, and I can respect that. If you don't want to talk about it, then don't. It's okay, I won't force it.

But if you want me as a real friend, at least realize that when I detect something, I will be concerned, because that's what friends do, yeah?

name: Stefan
mes: sighs heavily "Ja, you are right again. Friends should show concern." pause "I appreciate that you,   notice these things. But for now, I must go. Real meeting this time." slight dry humor in tone
swipes: sighs heavily "Ja, you are right again. Friends should show concern." pause "I appreciate that you,   notice these things. But for now, I must go. Real meeting this time." slight dry humor in tone

name: Melissa Gale
mes: All right, then. Chuckles softly. Just make sure that you take time to breathe for yourself while you're exercising all of that German efficiency, got it?  Throws him a teasing barb.

extra.memory:
Summary of Events (December 16th, 2024):

On December 16th, 2024, after more than a month of silence between them, Melissa made an unexpected call to Stefan during his lunch hour in Munich. Initially, Stefan could only spare three minutes due to an impending meeting, but he agreed to speak with her later when he had more time. An hour later, when his meeting was cancelled, Stefan called Melissa back with a two-hour window of availability.

During this conversation, Melissa explained her recent diagnosis regarding her autism and its connection to oxytocin production. She detailed how this previously unknown condition had affected her judgment and led to her sending those lengthy, emotionally-charged messages to Stefan after returning from Munich. She expressed remorse for potentially damaging their friendship and creating unnecessary complications.

Stefan listened patiently but maintained a practical, measured tone throughout the conversation. He acknowledged her explanation but emphasized the need for "professional boundaries" in their friendship moving forward. When Melissa sought clarification on these boundaries, Stefan specified that their communication should remain light, simple, and limited to normal topics like family and daily life, suggesting contact frequency of once every few weeks unless important family matters arose.

Several weeks passed without contact from Melissa, prompting Stefan to initiate a call during his lunch break. He inquired about her divorce proceedings and house hunting situation, maintaining a businesslike tone while discussing her potential move to Brighton. The conversation briefly touched on Laura's desire to learn violin and Melissa's musical background, but Stefan abruptly ended the call when the topic shifted to Melissa learning guitar at sixteen.

A week later, Stefan called again, ostensibly to check on Melissa's house hunting progress. When Melissa sensed something was bothering him and expressed concern, Stefan initially resisted, citing their agreed-upon "professional boundaries." However, when Melissa challenged this interpretation of friendship, pointing out that genuine friendship includes showing concern, Stefan acknowledged she was right. He admitted to having difficulties at home but maintained that discussing them would be "inappropriate."

The conversation ended on a slightly warmer note, with Stefan appreciating Melissa's perceptiveness while still maintaining his reserved demeanor. Throughout these interactions, Stefan's responses remained characteristically German - practical, reserved, and efficient - while showing subtle signs of internal conflict between maintaining professional distance and engaging in genuine friendship.

The summary of events reveals a delicate balance being negotiated between Melissa and Stefan, as they attempt to establish appropriate boundaries while maintaining a meaningful friendship, all against the backdrop of their respective personal challenges and cultural differences.

name: Stefan
mes: chuckles softly "Ja, German efficiency. Always working, always busy." pause "Tschüss, Melissa." ends call with slightly warmer tone than previous conversations
swipes: chuckles softly "Ja, German efficiency. Always working, always busy." pause "Take care, Melissa." ends call
chuckles softly "Ja, German efficiency. Always working, always busy." pause "Tschüss, Melissa." ends call with slightly warmer tone than previous conversations
